definition: the emperor's hand/variant of 馭手|驭手[yu4 shou3]
to resist/imperial/(classical) to drive (a chariot)/to manage/to govern
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: When Mr Mitarai was in the US, that was how he operated, too.
sentences.chinese: 御手洗先生在美國時，那也是他的經營方法。

sentences.english: He also believes in lifetime employment.
sentences.chinese: 御手洗還支持員工終身僱用制。

sentences.english: Mr Mitarai has come up with a different management model.
sentences.chinese: 御手洗先生想出了一個不同的管理模式。

sentences.english: Viewed from one angle, Mr Mitarai seems the archetype of a Japanese businessman.
sentences.chinese: 從某個角度看，御手洗似乎是典型的日本商人。

definition: person in charge of pack animals/chariot driver
(literary) palanquin/sedan chair/to ride in a palanquin
defense of the imperial palace or of the capital/the palace guard (or a member of that unit)
